intro: Schwenckia deflorata, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a striking display of clustered yellow blooms. Schwenckia deflorata is also known for its ability to thrive in moist soil conditions, making it a hardy plant in suitable environments.
